Description: Fragment from the neck area of a tunic, mainly undyed linen with integrally woven tapestry decoration in linen and coloured wool; small square shoulder ornament (4.5x4 cm) with a green and red bird in a white roundel, framed with a waved border; short narrow (1.5 cm) clavus with a red ground and leaf-shaped pendant, has small blue and white motifs (birds and fishes) and a green and white 'picket fence' border; clavus flanked on the inside with two triple and one double self-bands in undyed linen, the double ones turning into twining across end of neck opening, a red thread brocaded down the centre; neck opening itself survives only as a section of rolled hem; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/c.19), weft-undyed linen (S/c.12); tapestry on paired threads: warp-undyed linen (S/c.10), weft-green, red, white, blue wool (S/c.55); edges torn or fragmentary; sewing repairs at the neck is oversewing in linen (S spun Z ply); remaining traces of waist tuck directly below the clavus, neck opening would origianlly have had internal selvedges turned back and hemmed due to wear
Curator's comments: Unreg. 10; found 1988? in packet in Keeper's Office
